title: @Meddler: What Champion Roles Are In the Pipeline?
body: You've mentioned previously that there are something like 5-6 champions currently in the pipeline at varying levels of completion.  Could you comment on what roles these champions will fill (at least the ones that are far enough along that it's actually been decided)?  So something like "We're currently working on a mage, a fighter, and a tank.  The others aren't far enough along yet to say."

replies.body:
What roles upcoming champions are is something we want to leave to the initial champion teaser/reveal, since role's a key part of a champion's identity. 

At any point in time we aim to have a wide range of roles under development so that we can mix up the different roles being released. Role is one of the things that's usually locked down really early in a champion's development (with occasional changes if a new direction shows a lot of promise). 2014, by release order, had a mage, tank support, fighter/tank, mage, marksman, fighter and that's the sort of variety we'll be aiming for this year as well.
Since I was curious, figure other people may be too. The champions released in 2014 were, in order: Vel'Koz, Braum, Gnar, Azir, Kalista, and Rek'Sai.

It feels so weird to realise there was only six champions released last year.

Like I knew it had slowed down to 'one about every 2-3 months', but to actually see it written out and numbered just feels *weird*

Whilst of course you won't reveal it, will we being seeing an Assassin any time soon?

The last true Assassin we received was Zed - Riot's poster boy for a balanced Assassin (which I agree with, and want to see more of!)

For a class that's so controversial due to traditionally low counterplay, I certainly wouldn't mind seeing some more in the "new age of champion design" vs Riot's 2009-mid 2013 stuff.

Question: the last true assassin release was way back in 2012 with Zed -- has Riot strayed away from releasing assassins because of their frustrating, potentially-problematic nature; or just because there haven't been great ideas for one?
Fair enough.  Thanks for the response.
